body_html:
The conda packages are built against protobuf. We chose protobuf 3.4.1 because it is fairly recent. The conda install of Caffe2 knows to install a compatible version of protobuf when it installs Caffe2. If you later change this version of protobuf to something else, then Caffe2 might not work anymore, because it is linking against a library that has different symbols. We will not build a separate Caffe2 conda package for every version of protobuf.

What do you mean by "try to compile a C++ application with Caffe2" ? What is throwing that error? Compilation of Caffe2 or compilation of your C++ application? Is it compiling with cmake and rebuilding Caffe2?

It also looks like you have your brew directories before your conda directories on your PATH. This is a bad idea, and you should move the conda directories to be first.

What do you mean by "try to compile a C++ application with Caffe2" ? What is throwing that error? Compilation of Caffe2 or compilation of your C++ application? Is it compiling with cmake and rebuilding Caffe2?
It also looks like you have your brew directories before your conda directories on your PATH. This is a bad idea, and you should move the conda directories to be first.
body:
The conda packages are built against protobuf. We chose protobuf 3.4.1 because it is fairly recent. The conda install of Caffe2 knows to install a compatible version of protobuf when it installs Caffe2. If you later change this version of protobuf to something else, then Caffe2 might not work anymore, because it is linking against a library that has different symbols. We will not build a separate Caffe2 conda package for every version of protobuf.

What do you mean by "try to compile a C++ application with Caffe2" ? What is throwing that error? Compilation of Caffe2 or compilation of your C++ application? Is it compiling with cmake and rebuilding Caffe2?

It also looks like you have your brew directories before your conda directories on your PATH. This is a bad idea, and you should move the conda directories to be first.
